descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer – Web & Mobile Automation

Location: Hybrid – Onsite 3 Days/Week (Confidential Client Site, Bay Area)

Employment Type: W2 Contract Only

Pay Rate: Competitive $50/hour

Duration: 3 Months (Potential for extension or conversion)

Work Hours: Full-time, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM PT

Interview Process:





  • Round 1: TA Phone Screen




  • Round 2: Webex Panel Interview




  • (Optional) Round 3: Technical Onsite Interview

    Background/References: Required






Introduction

TPG is hiring a Quality Assurance Engineer to join a growing QA Studio team for a confidential digital transformation project with a leading global brand. This role is project-based with a fixed start date of Tuesday, July 1st and will focus on web and mobile platform QA. Engineers with a passion for sleek user experiences, detailed test execution, and modern automation frameworks are encouraged to apply.



This is a great opportunity for hands-on professionals who are strong in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and QA automation frameworks, and are available to work onsite 3 days/week in the Bay Area.




Key Responsibilities



  • Design, build, and execute test scripts for websites and mobile applications




  • Maintain and enhance automation frameworks (Web and Mobile)




  • Collaborate with dev and design teams to ensure product quality




  • Review functional/design specs and write detailed test plans and test cases




  • Debug and write defect reports, verify fixes, and communicate testing risks




  • Work across front-end, API, and back-end systems to validate integrated functionality




  • Use automation tools (e.g., Selenium, Appium, Protractor) to drive test coverage




  • Participate in project risk evaluation and provide QA estimates




  • Ensure quality standards through manual and automated testing






Required Skills & Experience



  • 4+ years of QA Engineering experience in web and mobile environments




  • Proficiency with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive design principles




  • Solid experience with automation testing using tools such as:





    • Selenium WebDriver, Appium, Protractor, Mocha, Jasmine, TestNG






  • Working knowledge of REST APIs, JSON, and XML




  • Familiarity with front-end frameworks: React, Angular, or Vue.js




  • Backend and database testing experience




  • Experience with GitLab, Jenkins, or similar CI/CD tools




  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills




  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience




  • Must be able to work onsite 3 days/week and be available for in-person interviews if shortlisted






Preferred Qualifications



  • Experience testing mobile applications on iOS and Android




  • Familiarity with cross-browser testing tools and performance testing




  • Exposure to Agile/Scrum environments with frequent release cycles




  • Experience working in fast-paced, design-forward enterprise environments






Excited to test next-gen digital platforms for a world-class brand?





Apply today to bring your automation and QA skills to a fast-paced, highly visible initiative.



 



#TECH #Onsite
title: QA Engineer

descriptionHtml:
***This is an on-site position in College Station, TX and will require relocation to the area.


A proactive and driven team player is required to passionately support delivery and embedding of the Data Integrity projects at FUJIFILM Biotechnologies, Texas. The Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist III for Data Integrity will be responsible for the day to day running of the FUJIFILM Biotechnologies, Texas Data Integrity Program, performing data integrity assessments, gap confirmation and risk assessments, generate remediation plans and categorize gaps based on business priority and risks.


Reports to Senior Director, QA Compliance

Work Location College Station, TX


Primary Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with all levels of the FUJIFILM Biotechnologies, Texas site to instill a ‘Quality Culture’ by coaching in the application of GMP Principles including the underlying rational of those principles.
  • Act as an ambassador for FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Quality Culture.
  • Deputize fronting Data Integrity in customer and regulatory audits (as required).
  • Work with Quality management to implement quality systems that will enable cGMP manufacturing of pre-clinical to commercial products.
  • Work as a change agent to compliantly improve existing or introduce new ways of working.
  • Strong experience with GMP, manufacturing processes, quality and regulatory requirements.
  • Ensure smooth operation of the FUJIFILM Biotechnologies, Texas Data Integrity program highlighting any issues in a timely manner.
  • Provide guidance and advice to ensure Data Integrity remediation actions are successfully completed.
  • Provide coaching and training for staff in Data Integrity Principles.
  • Engage in global FUJIFILM Biotechnologies projects and meetings to include being an active participant in work groups, and assessment of existing and new global systems.
  • Schedule and perform assessments, gap confirmation and schedule stakeholder follow-up.
  • Review pre-purchase of systems and analyze to ensure Data Integrity Compliance.
  • Draft FMEAs and lead stakeholder meetings.
  • Raise and manage change controls and CAPAs, and drive mitigation and remediation.
  • All other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree with 3+ years of experience in Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology or other regulated Industry.
  • Master’s Degree with 1+ years experience in Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology or other regulated Industry.
  • Involvement in Data Integrity projects during previous roles.
  • Strong understanding of 21 CFR Part 11 and Annex 11 regulations, FDA, GMP, GAMP and ISPE. Develop staff to maximize contributions to the team and the company.
  • Ability to multitask and easily prioritize work.
  • Ability to work independently with little supervision.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
  • All candidates must have a working knowledge of cGMP regulations for the production of drug, biologics or vaccine products.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders from across the business, at all levels.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational, analytical, data review and report writing skills.
  • Motivated cross functional worker.
  • Ability to set and achieve personal performance goals.
  • Provide input to departmental objectives.
title: QA Specialist III, Quality Systems/Data Integrity (On-Site in College Station, TX)

description: Primary Responsibilities: • Develop and maintain detailed test scripts and test cases based on new and evolving website functionality. • Execute test cases including end-to-end testing to validate functionality, usability, integration, and cross-browser compatibility. • Log bugs and issues clearly and consistently within Jira, including steps to reproduce and indicating severity for all bug prioritization. • Monitor Jira to track bug resolution progress and retesting activities. • Collaborate closely with development teams to ensure timely fixes and verify issue resolution. • Establish and document a repeatable testing workflow: test → log → resolve → retest → ready for business test → close. • Perform smoke/sanity testing for initial build validation. • Responsible and accountable for system and regression testing to validate system integrity after code changes. • Serve as a consultant with Compliance Testing and Security Testing. • Remain responsive with System testing and Regression testing updates resulting from changes with unit testing and disaster recovery testing. • Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes and coordinate with business testers as needed. • Create and maintain test documentation and QA metrics to communicate status and risks. • Ensure test coverage across supported browsers and devices to maintain consistent user experience. • Coordinate and lead bug management with vendors and AD project team member with input from Product Owner and IT. • Fulfill Quality Assurance responsibilities through Implementation including warranty. • Participate in daily stand up and report on bug status and escalate blockers/concerns to PM and IT Manager. Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience. • 3+ years of experience in website quality assurance or software testing roles. • Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle and QA methodologies. • Experience using Jira or similar issue tracking tools. • Detail-oriented with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced project environment. • Familiarity with content management systems such as Drupal is a plus. • Experience in Agile/Scrum environments is preferred. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: • Strong understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to help identify front-end issues and better communicate with developers. • Experience with Drupal CMS or other content management systems to understand site structure and admin workflows. • Familiarity with cross-browser and responsive design testing tools. • Knowledge of QA tools and test case management systems. • Understanding of software testing principles including functional, regression, smoke, and UAT testing. • Ability to create and optimize test documentation to track cases, issues, and retesting outcomes. • Experience in Agile development environments, including participation in sprint planning and retrospectives. • Clear and concise communication skills to effectively report bugs and collaborate with cross-functional teams.Quality Assurance, Software Quality Assurance, JIRA, Drupal, Manual Test Scripts, Manual Testing, Automated Test ScriptsTechnology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. descriptionHtml:
Primary Responsibilities:
• Develop and maintain detailed test scripts and test cases based on new and evolving website functionality.
• Execute test cases including end-to-end testing to validate functionality, usability, integration, and cross-browser compatibility.
• Log bugs and issues clearly and consistently within Jira, including steps to reproduce and indicating severity for all bug prioritization.
• Monitor Jira to track bug resolution progress and retesting activities.
• Collaborate closely with development teams to ensure timely fixes and verify issue resolution.
• Establish and document a repeatable testing workflow: test → log → resolve → retest → ready for business test → close.
• Perform smoke/sanity testing for initial build validation.
• Responsible and accountable for system and regression testing to validate system integrity after code changes.
• Serve as a consultant with Compliance Testing and Security Testing.
• Remain responsive with System testing and Regression testing updates resulting from changes with unit testing and disaster recovery testing.
• Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes and coordinate with business testers as needed.
• Create and maintain test documentation and QA metrics to communicate status and risks.
• Ensure test coverage across supported browsers and devices to maintain consistent user experience.
• Coordinate and lead bug management with vendors and AD project team member with input from Product Owner and IT.
• Fulfill Quality Assurance responsibilities through Implementation including warranty.
• Participate in daily stand up and report on bug status and escalate blockers/concerns to PM and IT Manager.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience.
• 3+ years of experience in website quality assurance or software testing roles.
• Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle and QA methodologies.
• Experience using Jira or similar issue tracking tools.
• Detail-oriented with strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced project environment.
• Familiarity with content management systems such as Drupal is a plus.
• Experience in Agile/Scrum environments is preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Strong understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to help identify front-end issues and better communicate with developers.
• Experience with Drupal CMS or other content management systems to understand site structure and admin workflows.
• Familiarity with cross-browser and responsive design testing tools.
• Knowledge of QA tools and test case management systems.
• Understanding of software testing principles including functional, regression, smoke, and UAT testing.
• Ability to create and optimize test documentation to track cases, issues, and retesting outcomes.
• Experience in Agile development environments, including participation in sprint planning and retrospectives.
• Clear and concise communication skills to effectively report bugs and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Quality Assurance, Software Quality Assurance, JIRA, Drupal, Manual Test Scripts, Manual Testing, Automated Test Scripts

descriptionHtml:
About The Company

Logitech is a global leader in designing and manufacturing innovative peripherals and accessories that enhance the digital experience. Committed to creating products that improve productivity, entertainment, and communication, Logitech serves a diverse range of customers worldwide. The company emphasizes sustainability, inclusivity, and technological advancement, fostering a work environment that encourages creativity and collaboration. Logitech’s mission is to enable people to do their best work and enjoy their digital lives through high-quality, reliable, and thoughtfully designed solutions.

About The Role

As a Sr. Software QA Engineer at Logitech, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality, stability, and performance of Logitech’s next-generation software and firmware platforms across the Video Collaboration product line. You will serve as a hands-on quality leader, working closely with cross-functional teams—including development, product management, UX, and hardware teams—to define and execute comprehensive test strategies throughout the product lifecycle. This role demands a proactive mindset, a strong technical foundation, and leadership capabilities to guide QA efforts across geographically distributed teams. You will be responsible for test planning, defect triage, and ensuring on-time delivery of high-quality releases in a fast-paced, complex environment.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics, or a related engineering field
  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in software quality assurance
  • At least 2+ years in a senior QA role
  • Strong background in manual testing methodologies including functional, integration, system, and regression testing
  • Experience working in Agile/Scrum development environments with global cross-functional teams
  • Expertise in writing detailed test plans, test cases, and test reports based on product requirements and user workflows
  • Proficiency with test case management and defect tracking tools such as TestRail, Zephyr, JIRA
  • Solid troubleshooting and defect isolation skills across software, firmware, and hardware interfaces
  • Basic understanding of automation frameworks (Python) is a plus
  • Experience testing complex consumer devices such as video bars
  • Knowledge of USB, Bluetooth, or wireless communication protocols
  • Familiarity with video/audio testing concepts including codec behavior, camera framing, voice pickup, and conferencing platform integration (Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet)
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven leadership in mentoring junior QA engineers and driving quality initiatives

Responsibilities

  • Define and own manual test strategies for new product features, firmware, and platform-level changes
  • Create detailed test plans, scenarios, and cases based on product requirements and risk analysis
  • Ensure comprehensive test coverage across functional, regression, exploratory, and edge case testing
  • Execute manual testing across multiple product lines and platforms
  • Log defects with clear reproduction steps, root cause analysis, and severity classification
  • Track and report test results using tools like Zephyr, ensuring clarity and consistency
  • Act as a QA owner within cross-functional scrum teams, representing quality throughout the SDLC
  • Participate in design reviews, requirement walkthroughs, and sprint planning to provide QA insights early in the development process
  • Manage the quality gate for feature readiness, ensuring all criteria are met before production release
  • Collaborate closely with development, firmware, UX, and product teams to clarify expected behaviors and prioritize issues
  • Lead defect triage sessions, influencing resolution of blockers and critical issues
  • Coordinate with global QA teams to align test case ownership, coverage, and reporting schedules
  • Identify testing gaps, process inefficiencies, and potential quality risks, proposing improvements to workflows
  • Contribute to the development and refinement of QA standards, documentation, and best practices
  • Manage test case execution across multiple sites and time zones, ensuring consistent results and issue tracking
  • Review and consolidate test results from different regions to support comprehensive reporting and defect visibility

Benefits

  • Competitive annual salary ranging between $140,000 and $180,000, with higher compensation possible based on experience and business needs
  • Flexible working arrangements, including remote work options and hybrid models
  • Comprehensive benefits packages tailored to various locations, supporting physical, emotional, financial, and social wellbeing
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development within a global company
  • Inclusive and diverse work environment that values authenticity and collaboration
  • Supportive culture encouraging innovation, creativity, and work-life balance

Equal Opportunity

Logitech is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.
title: QA Engineer, Sr.

description: Our client located in Carrollton is in search of a Senior Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist to help shape the future of their DART suite of applications and Corporate Systems. In this critical role, you’ll be the gatekeeper of quality—testing software and hardware to ensure every release meets the highest standards. You’ll work closely with development teams, lead testing efforts, write detailed test cases for automation, and guide junior QA team members to success.WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU: Enjoy the flexibility of a fully remote work model, designed to support a healthy work-life balance and offer freedom in managing your daily schedule.Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance with Flexible Spending AccountUnlimited PTOLife Insurance, AD&D, & Supplemental LifeShort- & Long-term DisabilityTuition BenefitsWHAT YOU’LL DO:Execute manual testing on business-critical applications to validate performance, usability, and functionality.Create and maintain thorough test plans and test cases that align with project goals.Analyze test results, report defects, and collaborate with developers to ensure timely resolution.Partner with cross-functional teams to test new features, identify issues, and provide actionable feedback for improvement.Mentor and support junior QA team members, sharing knowledge and best practices.Participate in project planning and estimation, ensuring quality requirements are addressed early.Write robust test cases for automation engineers to streamline future regression testing.Represent QA in project meetings, communicating testing progress and roadblocks.WHAT YOU’LL BRING:4+ years of hands-on experience in manual testing for websites, mobile apps, and hardware products.Bachelor's degree (preferred) or equivalent experience.Deep understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and best practices.Exposure to programming languages such as SQL, .NET, or web technologies.Familiarity with automation testing tools and frameworks—hands-on experience is a plus.Proficiency with tools like JIRA, Confluence, and working in Agile environments.Proven ability to write detailed and effective test plans and test cases.Apply Today! descriptionHtml:
Our client located in Carrollton is in search of a Senior Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist to help shape the future of their DART suite of applications and Corporate Systems. In this critical role, you’ll be the gatekeeper of quality—testing software and hardware to ensure every release meets the highest standards. You’ll work closely with development teams, lead testing efforts, write detailed test cases for automation, and guide junior QA team members to success.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU:

  • Enjoy the flexibility of a fully remote work model, designed to support a healthy work-life balance and offer freedom in managing your daily schedule.
  • Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance with Flexible Spending Account
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Life Insurance, AD&D, & Supplemental Life
  • Short- & Long-term Disability
  • Tuition Benefits


WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Execute manual testing on business-critical applications to validate performance, usability, and functionality.
  • Create and maintain thorough test plans and test cases that align with project goals.
  • Analyze test results, report defects, and collaborate with developers to ensure timely resolution.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to test new features, identify issues, and provide actionable feedback for improvement.
  • Mentor and support junior QA team members, sharing knowledge and best practices.
  • Participate in project planning and estimation, ensuring quality requirements are addressed early.
  • Write robust test cases for automation engineers to streamline future regression testing.
  • Represent QA in project meetings, communicating testing progress and roadblocks.


WHAT YOU’LL BRING:

  • 4+ years of hands-on experience in manual testing for websites, mobile apps, and hardware products.
  • Bachelor's degree (preferred) or equivalent experience.
  • Deep understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and best practices.
  • Exposure to programming languages such as SQL, .NET, or web technologies.
  • Familiarity with automation testing tools and frameworks—hands-on experience is a plus.
  • Proficiency with tools like JIRA, Confluence, and working in Agile environments.
  • Proven ability to write detailed and effective test plans and test cases.


Apply Today! CP #8490
title: Senior Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist
workType: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Strategy/Planning

descriptionHtml:
Greetings from Sligo Software Solutions, Inc. !!

This is Dasharatham from SLIGO. We have an urgent requirement for Sr. Tester position with our client.

Title : Sr. Tester

Location : Albany, New York

Duration : 24 Months

Client : NY State - Department of Health

Job ID: SLG - 19 - 11125

Respond by: 09/23/25 5:00 PM

Description

Support, maintain and enhance DOH Vital Records applications as required.

Duties

  • The Tester will focus on Quality Assurance activities and responsibilities that will include but not be limited to:
  • Develop test plans, scenarios, and test cases which will exercise the business, functional, and technical requirements of the system.
  • Develop test data for use in executing the QA phase of the SDLC.
  • Develop and execute test plans and scenarios, including regression and volume tests.
  • Evaluate test results and performance of software.
  • Identify technical and functional software defects.
  • Work with the project team to complete the QA process to bring the software quality to a level where it can be delivered to NYSDOH for user acceptance tests.
  • Assist NYSDOH staff in performing user acceptance tests.

Mandatory Requirements

  • Experience (12+ Years)
  • Conducts automated and manual tests to ensure that the software created/upgraded performs as necessary and meets the user requirements. Develops and maintains user and technical documentation and project process documentation for application teams. Understands the view of applications and/or technology and is able to put procedures in a logical sequence.

Requirements

  • This is an 100% Onsite
  • 84 Months of experience in performing Quality Assurance tasks.
  • 84 Months of experience in the development and execution of Software Test Plans and Scenarios.
  • 84 Months of experience in Functional testing using functional testing tools.
  • 48 Months of experience in Performance and Stress testing using performance testing tools.
  • 48 Months of experience in Manual Testing.
  • 48 Months of experience in creating user test scripts and managing User Acceptance Testing.
  • 48 Months of experience in using defect management tools.
  • 12 Months experience using Redmine.
  • 12 Months of experience in using HP Quality Center.
  • Résumé
  • Copy of Candidate Identification (i.e., Driver’s License/Green Card/Visa and Passport if applicable)
  • Any documents referenced in the above Requested Qualifications (i.e., professional certifications, degrees, etc.)

Thank you,

Katta Dasharatham

Recruiting Team Lead

Sligo Software Solutions Inc.

dasharatham.katta@sligosoft.com

www.sligosoft.com

Direct: (518) 818-6239

Office: (518) 444 0459 x 116

Fax : (518) 444 0457

https://www.linkedin.com/in/dasharatham/

  • Due to my back-to-back calls, there are times when I might miss your calls. Email is the best way to reach me**

descriptionHtml:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

As a General QA (AI Trainer), you will help ensure the quality of prompts and outputs by reviewing tasks for language quality, guideline accuracy, and consistency. You will serve as the final quality check before work is sent to the client.

Responsibilities:

  • Prompt & Output Review: Evaluate AI prompts and responses for clarity, correctness, fairness, and compliance with guidelines. Provide feedback to ensure outputs meet high-quality standards.
  • Content Refinement: Identify issues such as ambiguity, factual errors, formatting inconsistencies, or bias in AI outputs, and suggest improvements.
  • Auditing Work: Review tasks completed by other contributors, ensuring they follow project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback and edit content as needed to improve quality.
  • Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
  • Guideline Application: Apply quality rubrics consistently to ensure outputs align with established standards

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree n any discipline (no specific field required)
  • You have at least 3-5 years of professional experience in a role requiring attention to detail, critical thinking, or quality review
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $30/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
title: Freelance General - QA / AI Trainer

descriptionHtml:
Job Overview

The QA Engineer is responsible for managing and optimizing test tools, contributing to automation strategies, and overseeing performance testing to ensure scalable and reliable software delivery. This role includes managing test environments to support consistent, stable, and efficient testing across all phases of development. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is essential to embed quality throughout the software lifecycle and drive continuous improvement. The position also contributes to shaping the future vision of QA practices through innovation, metrics-driven insights, and strategic planning.

Key Responsibilities

Automated Test and Performance Test Oversight & Strategy:

  • Works with leadership to drive QA enterprise strategy
  • Identifying suitable test cases for automation, designing and documenting test automation strategies. Gathering non-functional requirements, analyzing critical business scenarios, understanding service level agreement (SLA) -objectives and creating comprehensive performance test strategies and plans.
  • Has expertise with a variety of industry tools, strong technical skills with script development, review and maintenance using various scripting languages, building automation frameworks to support different testing layers (UI, API, database). Performance scripting using tools like LoadRunner, JMeter, incorporating features such as parameterization, checkpoints, transactions, and reusable functions.
  • Serve as backup and escalation to team of performance test engineers and automation analysts.

Test Environment Management

  • Setting up and configuring necessary test environments including allocation, configuration management, and ensuring production like environments in lower instances.

Tool Administration

  • Ensure tool administration and maintenance across the QA function including automated and performance test tools, Mobile Center, upkeep of servers used by QA ensuring enterprise level consistency.

Collaboration & Communication

  • Working closely with product teams to understand requirements, application architecture to ensure software quality. -Working closely with developers and other cross-functional teams to troubleshoot performance issues, and implement solutions.
  • Work hand in hand with a team of onsite and offshore team focused on performance and automated test development and execution. Perform script review and provide feedback/coaching to team members and partners to ensure standards are upheld throughout automated & performance test activities.

Continuous Improvement

  • Staying updated on industry trends, tools, Gen AI influence on automation techniques and performance testing methodologies, and continuously improving existing tests and processes.

Required Technical Skills

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in software test engineering, automation scripting and performance testing.
  • Experience in working with contract/external resources for software testing and reporting
  • Experience in test automation strategy and development
  • OpenText tool administrator experience (ALM, UFT, LoadRunner)
  • Thorough understanding of development and testing life cycles (SDLC/STLC)

Required Education

  • BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science, Business or Mathematics.

Other Key Qualifications

  • Demonstrated initiative and ownership
  • Able to influence decision makers
  • Proven ability to effectively manage competing priorities
  • Strong organizational and planning skills
  • Strong analysis and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability and willingness to adapt to changing priorities and/or projects
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of people at all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high pressure environment

Preferred Skills And Experience

  • Knowledge of Restaurant Operations
title: QA Engineer

description: We are a well-funded startup on a mission to make e-commerce logistics more efficient and human-friendly with AI-powered robotics .Founded by leading robot AI engineers, we are growing our world-class team to deploy robots at scale. Join us in helping people handle more throughout the supply chain!We’re looking for a Robotics QA Intern to help us ensure high quality of Ambi products from mid October until the end of the year. In this role, you will test robots and analyze the results to validate core product functionality to improve warehouse operations. When applicable, you will also help us design new tests and create documentation. You will work closely with the Software team and the CTO.You are a good fit if you have:Excitement about making a real-world impact for people in the warehouse, putting product function first.A bias toward action: you work with urgency and actively seek ways to helpHigh accountabilityAttention to detailStrong communication skills, both in terms of written documentation and note takingWe offer benefits such as:Access to a full gym at HQFree parking on site at HQFree lunches 3x per weekPLEASE NOTE:This is not a full time role. Working hours will vary from 10 hours a week to 40 hours a week.The role will, at times, require significant physical effort such as moving 50 lb boxes.There is potential for this to convert to a full time role, should this internship be successful.$20 - $25 an hourPosition title and compensation will be matched to applicant's experience.Ambi Robotics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage and embrace applicants of all backgrounds to apply!DisclaimersAmbi Robotics provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.Ambi Robotics will comply with federal and state mandates regarding COVID-19 vaccinations. We will require employees coming on-site to be vaccinated or in compliance with weekly testing requirements.Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
descriptionHtml:
We are a well-funded startup on a mission to make e-commerce logistics more efficient and human-friendly with AI-powered robotics .

Founded by leading robot AI engineers, we are growing our world-class team to deploy robots at scale. Join us in helping people handle more throughout the supply chain!

We’re looking for a Robotics QA Intern to help us ensure high quality of Ambi products from mid October until the end of the year. In this role, you will test robots and analyze the results to validate core product functionality to improve warehouse operations. When applicable, you will also help us design new tests and create documentation. You will work closely with the Software team and the CTO.

You are a good fit if you have:

  • Excitement about making a real-world impact for people in the warehouse, putting product function first.
  • A bias toward action: you work with urgency and actively seek ways to help
  • High accountability
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills, both in terms of written documentation and note taking

We offer benefits such as:

  • Access to a full gym at HQ
  • Free parking on site at HQ
  • Free lunches 3x per week

PLEASE NOTE:

  • This is not a full time role. Working hours will vary from 10 hours a week to 40 hours a week.
  • The role will, at times, require significant physical effort such as moving 50 lb boxes.
  • There is potential for this to convert to a full time role, should this internship be successful.

$20 - $25 an hour

Position title and compensation will be matched to applicant's experience.

Ambi Robotics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage and embrace applicants of all backgrounds to apply!

Disclaimers

Ambi Robotics provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Ambi Robotics will comply with federal and state mandates regarding COVID-19 vaccinations. We will require employees coming on-site to be vaccinated or in compliance with weekly testing requirements.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
title: Robotics QA Intern

descriptionHtml:
Weekend Wake Up! Could this be you?


QA Manager | Full Time Permanent | Remote (ideally Central or Eastern Time Zones)


Innovative oncology focused Biotech, rapidly growing company, pioneering a first-of-its-kind surgical oncology technology, with a recent approval and gaining significant global traction.


This is a fantastic chance to join a cutting-edge organization in a high-visibility role, reporting directly to the VP of QA. The position offers clear scope for growth, strategic input, and real impact as the company scales.


Responsibilities

  • Oversee the evaluation and management of suppliers to ensure the quality of products or services provided by GxP suppliers.
  • Develop/improve, implement, and maintain the quality management system (QMS) to comply with FDA, and regulatory
  • Work with Clinical Operations to develop and implement clinical quality risk management strategies ensuring compliance with Good Clinical Practices (GCP).
  • Up to date with current FDA regulations
  • Collaborate with other departments, such as CMC, Clinical, GMP, Research and Development, and Regulatory Affairs, to ensure consistent quality across all aspects of the product lifecycle.


Qualifications & Skills

  • Must have Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry (or similar field)
  • 4+ years’ experience in pharmaceutical / CRO / Biotech / GMP / GCP
  • Experience in sterile manufacturing, sterile environment experience
  • Exposure to Regulatory Affairs or an interest in learning the Regulatory Affairs role is a plus.
title: Quality Assurance Manager

description: Job DescriptionWFI International, a leading manufacturer and supplier of integrally reinforced branch connection fittings to the power, oil and gas, chemical, and other industries, is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability, or protected veteran status.The Company Is a Drug Free Workplace.The Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for assisting the Quality Assurance Manager in establishing, implementing, and continually improving the performance of the Quality Management System.Primary ResponsibilitiesInterface with Sales, Materials, Engineering, Production and Customers to ensure applicable requirements and customer expectations are being fully understood and satisfied.Support the Quality Inspectors to ensure that products and processes comply with the relevant requirements of our customers and the Quality Management System.Resolve and prevent the reoccurrence of various quality issues relative to product, process, customer complaints, and quality system requirements.Develop and maintain project quality documentation such as supplements, records, Inspection and Test Plans (ITP), Manufacturing Procedure Specifications (MPS), etc.Supporting the processes of planning, organizing, and managing all project quality related activities including release of clear instructions to production and QC personnel.Analyzing the need for and managing correction actions for process related concerns, negative trends in business metrics, and product nonconformances using appropriate analytical tools.Assist in the development and maintenance of procedures within the Quality Management System.Education / ExperienceHigh School Diploma or GED is required.Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Quality, or Industrial Engineering is preferred.5-10 years related experience in manufacturing or similar field where the reading and interpretation of technical requirements was a routine task of the position.Experience working under an ISO-9001 certified QMS or similar Standard is required.Experience in supplying materials to the nuclear industry is a plus.Job Type: Full-time
descriptionHtml:
Job Description

WFI International, a leading manufacturer and supplier of integrally reinforced branch connection fittings to the power, oil and gas, chemical, and other industries, is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability, or protected veteran status.

The Company Is a Drug Free Workplace.

The Quality Assurance Engineer is responsible for assisting the Quality Assurance Manager in establishing, implementing, and continually improving the performance of the Quality Management System.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Interface with Sales, Materials, Engineering, Production and Customers to ensure applicable requirements and customer expectations are being fully understood and satisfied.
  • Support the Quality Inspectors to ensure that products and processes comply with the relevant requirements of our customers and the Quality Management System.
  • Resolve and prevent the reoccurrence of various quality issues relative to product, process, customer complaints, and quality system requirements.
  • Develop and maintain project quality documentation such as supplements, records, Inspection and Test Plans (ITP), Manufacturing Procedure Specifications (MPS), etc.
  • Supporting the processes of planning, organizing, and managing all project quality related activities including release of clear instructions to production and QC personnel.
  • Analyzing the need for and managing correction actions for process related concerns, negative trends in business metrics, and product nonconformances using appropriate analytical tools.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of procedures within the Quality Management System.

Education / Experience

  • High School Diploma or GED is required.
  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Quality, or Industrial Engineering is preferred.
  • 5-10 years related experience in manufacturing or similar field where the reading and interpretation of technical requirements was a routine task of the position.
  • Experience working under an ISO-9001 certified QMS or similar Standard is required.
  • Experience in supplying materials to the nuclear industry is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time
title: Quality Assurance Engineer

description: Position: QA EngineerCompensation: $70 - $90 /hrLocation: Kansas City, MissouriInceed has partnered with a great company to help find a skilled QA Engineer to join their team!Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Join a dynamic team that is committed to delivering high-quality data products and platforms. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a forward-thinking environment where you will play a vital role in ensuring quality assurance across complex technical ecosystems. Embrace the challenge and contribute to innovative solutions that meet business value and technical quality standards.Key Responsibilities & Duties:Design and implement test strategies for data platforms and APIs.Collaborate with developers to integrate testing into data pipelines.Create, execute, and automate test cases for data validation.Document test results and recommend corrective actions.Manage defect tickets with clear reproduction steps.Perform integration, regression, and performance testing.Build automated testing frameworks for CI/CD pipelines.Validate instrumentation and logging for observability.Participate in Agile ceremonies to enhance delivery workflows.Research and implement new testing technologies.Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in a related field.4+ years of development or QA testing experience.Strong knowledge of QA methodologies and testing approaches.Experience with test automation frameworks.Proficiency in a programming or scripting language.Familiarity with API testing tools and data platforms.Experience with CI/CD tools and agile practices.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.Nice to Have Skills & Experience: Experience with cloud environments like GCP or Snowflake.Familiarity with messaging/streaming platforms like Kafka.Knowledge of application performance monitoring tools.Relevant certifications like ISTQB.Perks & Benefits: 3 different medical health insurance plans, dental, and vision insuranceVoluntary and Long-term disability insurancePaid time off, 401k, and holiday payWeekly direct deposit or pay card depositIf you are interested in learning more about the QA Engineer opportunity, please submit your resume for consideration. descriptionHtml:
Position: QA Engineer

Compensation: $70 - $90 /hr

Location: Kansas City, Missouri

Inceed has partnered with a great company to help find a skilled QA Engineer to join their team!

Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Join a dynamic team that is committed to delivering high-quality data products and platforms. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a forward-thinking environment where you will play a vital role in ensuring quality assurance across complex technical ecosystems. Embrace the challenge and contribute to innovative solutions that meet business value and technical quality standards.

Key Responsibilities & Duties:

  • Design and implement test strategies for data platforms and APIs.
  • Collaborate with developers to integrate testing into data pipelines.
  • Create, execute, and automate test cases for data validation.
  • Document test results and recommend corrective actions.
  • Manage defect tickets with clear reproduction steps.
  • Perform integration, regression, and performance testing.
  • Build automated testing frameworks for CI/CD pipelines.
  • Validate instrumentation and logging for observability.
  • Participate in Agile ceremonies to enhance delivery workflows.
  • Research and implement new testing technologies.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
  • 4+ years of development or QA testing experience.
  • Strong knowledge of QA methodologies and testing approaches.
  • Experience with test automation frameworks.
  • Proficiency in a programming or scripting language.
  • Familiarity with API testing tools and data platforms.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and agile practices.
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Nice to Have Skills & Experience:

  • Experience with cloud environments like GCP or Snowflake.
  • Familiarity with messaging/streaming platforms like Kafka.
  • Knowledge of application performance monitoring tools.
  • Relevant certifications like ISTQB.

Perks & Benefits:

  • 3 different medical health insurance plans, dental, and vision insurance
  • Voluntary and Long-term disability insurance
  • Paid time off, 401k, and holiday pay
  • Weekly direct deposit or pay card deposit

If you are interested in learning more about the QA Engineer opportunity, please submit your resume for consideration. Our client is unable to provide sponsorship at this time.

We are Inceed, a staffing direct placement firm who believes in the possibility of something better. Our mission is simple: We’re here to help every person, whether client, candidate, or employee, find and secure what’s better for them.

Inceed is an equal opportunity employer. Inceed prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

descriptionHtml:
Piper Companies is hiring a Manual QA Tester for a small company local to Durham, NC. The Manual QA Tester will work on end to end testing and needs to be meticulous and detail-oriented. The Manual QA Tester will need to sit on site 3 days per week in Durham, NC and is a contract role with potential to hire.

Responsibilities for the Manual QA Tester:

  • Design, develop, and execute detailed test plans and test cases.
  • Perform manual testing of software applications to identify defects and ensure quality.
  • Conduct end-to-end testing to validate the complete workflow of applications, ensuring all components and systems work seamlessly together.
  • Perform API testing to verify the integrity and functionality of backend services, ensuring they interact correctly with the front-end systems.
  • Document and report bugs, issues, and defects clearly and concisely.
  • Collaborate with developers and product managers to resolve issues and ensure software meets requirements.
  • Conduct regression testing to validate that fixes do not affect existing functionalities.
  • Participate in test planning, requirement analysis, and review meetings.

Requirements for the Manual QA Tester:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field is required.
  • Proven experience as a Manual QA Tester or similar role.
  • Strong understanding of software testing methodologies and practices.
  • Experience with end-to-end testing and API testing.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Compensation for the Manual QA Tester:

  • $30.00-$40.00 per hour
  • Full Comprehensive benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, PTO, Sick Leave if required by law, and Holidays

Keywords: test engineer, manual test engineer, manual testing, end to end testing, regression, smoke, functional, API, black box, UAT, user acceptance testing,

#HYBRID

This job opens for applications on 9/22/2025. Applications for this job will be accepted for at least 30 days from the posting date.
title: Manual QA Tester

descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Quality Specialist (Audits & Compliance)

Location: Gibsonia, PA (100% Onsite, 5 days/week)

Type: Direct Hire

Additional compensation and benefits details will be shared during the hiring process.


Role Overview

The Quality Specialist II will oversee the planning, coordination, and execution of internal and external audits, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and inspection readiness. This role involves audit preparation, client interaction, CAPA resolution, and continuous improvement of audit and quality processes.

They are looking for a Quality Specialist with at least 3+ years of experience in regulated industries such as pharmaceuticals or ISO-accredited environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Client Audits
  • Plan, prepare, and host client audits.
  • Coordinate schedules, documentation, and communication with clients.
  • Lead responses to client audit findings via CAPA records.
  • Internal & External Audits
  • Conduct and lead internal QA audits.
  • Support vendor/supplier audits, data collection, and reporting.
  • Perform regulatory gap assessments.
  • Inspection Readiness
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to maintain accurate documentation.
  • Drive projects to enhance audit and compliance readiness.
  • Quality & Training
  • Review raw data, reports, and supporting documents.
  • Halt work if serious deficiencies are identified.
  • Perform quality closure reviews.
  • Support deviations, CAPAs, change control, and OOS records.
  • Assist with new hire and QA training.

What You Bring

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Experience: 3+ years in a regulated industry (pharma, ISO, quality assurance, audits).
  • Preferred: Internal Auditor certification (ISO standards), Lead Auditor training.
  • Skills:
  • Strong QA and audit management knowledge.
  • Experience with FDA, EMA, ISO 9001, ISO 17025.
  • Communication, teamwork, and client-facing skills.
  • Critical thinking, problem solving, and attention to detail.
  • Basic lab equipment knowledge and documentation skills.

What We Offer

  • A diverse, inclusive, and value-based workplace.
  • Award-winning corporate university with training & development.
  • Competitive base salary and innovative benefits package,
  • Opportunities to contribute to local communities.
sector: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, Retail Pharmacies, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
title: Quality Assurance Specialist

descriptionHtml:
SUMMARY
The Quality Inspector performs quality inspections and ensures quality problem resolution for product manufacturing and packaging according to procedures, specifications and standards. This position also assists the Quality department with administrative aspects of quality maintenance and remediation. This is a 3rd shift position, with working hours from 11:00pm – 7:30am, Monday through Friday.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
  • In-process quality checks – perform visual and physical verification of production logs, data and components; assist with documentation and segregation of nonconforming components; collect/document samples and deliver to QC
  • In-process quality checks – perform visual and physical verification of data, products and procedures throughout packaging, labeling, etc.
  • Alert production staff to stop production if quality problems are identified
  • Problem solves with production staff to achieve prompt resolution of identified quality issues
  • Equipment set up verifications  – Verify information, paperwork, logs, blends and components are correct against work orders and properly staged and that samples are available at each machine prior to production
  • Equipment changeover verifications  – Verify that previous product is fully cleared from processing equipment and downstream production and that new product information is correctly entered
  • GMP facility walks - Identify and correct GMP violations or inconsistencies in quality procedures
  • Verify that documentation is complete for the production run after changeovers
  • Batch Production Run review – perform final verification of hard copy and electronic BPR data
  • Assist with investigative tasks in the Quality Department
  • Assist in deviation report generation or development and implementation of corrective action plans
  • Assist with report writing, compiling and reporting results, SOP revisions and work instructions
  • Provide administrative support to the department
  • Assist with accurate data collection and metrics reporting (Nonconforming material, First Run Quality and Quality Audits)
  • Other duties as assigned
SUPERVISORY/BUDGET
  • N/A
REQUIREMENTS
Education/Experience:
  • High school graduate or equivalent
  • 1-2 years QA/QC experience in food, wine, pharma, or dietary supplements manufacturing facility preferred
  • Previous 3rd shift/graveyard experience strongly preferred
Knowledge/Abilities/Skills:
  • Intermediate mathematics skills including percentages
  • Conversant with units of measure such as grams or pounds
  • Able to solve problems and make decisions based on company and/or quality policy
  • Ability to read, interpret and apply quality standards, SOP’s, specifications and work instructions
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong organization and detailed work
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Commitment to and ability to demonstrate TM’s Company values: Find good intentions, Stay curious, Be real and open, Create together, Make a meaningful difference, Keep raising the bar
  • Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred
Technical Skills:
  • Intermediate MS Office skills
  • Production Management Software (RedZone preferred), System Integration Software (Ignition)
  • eQMS software (MasterControl)
  • Measurement tools and software including force gauge, calipers, balances, vacuum chambers
Travel Requirements:
  • N/A
Work Environment:
  • Fast paced production environment working across all areas of production including finished product, blending, case packing, warehouse maintenance and quality control
  • Simultaneous support for up to eight manufacturing lines along with all the ancillary equipment, tasks and processes
Office Hours/Location:
  • This position is based in Sebastopol, CA. Shift hours are from 11:00pm-7:30am, Monday through Friday, with occasional Saturday work.
  • Remote candidates will not be considered for this role.
Traditional Medicinals, Inc. and its subsidiaries are proud equal-opportunity employers.  We wholeheartedly embrace authenticity, diversity, and people's differences. We acknowledge, celebrate, and support individuality to the great advantage of our consumers, our stakeholders, our products, and the planet.  We are committed to building an inclusive workplace for all our people.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Compensation range is $24.62 - $32.31 per hour, plus 15% shift differential.

Compensation is determined based on non-discriminatory, business-related factors, including but not limited to, training, experience, education and/or professional certifications, geographic location, and market data.

descriptionHtml:
At Swyfft, we're reshaping the way home insurance and commercial package products are priced and bound. We've created an insurance experience that's smart, instant, and designed to deliver unparalleled customer service.


Our focus on lightning-fast quotes and seamless claims servicing is powered by cutting-edge technology and an Agent and Customer-centric approach that sets us apart in the industry.


Joining Swyfft means becoming part of a dynamic team of forward-thinkers who thrive on moving fast and delivering exceptional products. We pride ourselves on fostering an environment where creativity and positive energy thrive.


As we continue to grow and expand, we're on the lookout for experienced professionals like you to join us in transforming the insurance landscape. If you're passionate about leveraging technology to provide the best customer service experience and are ready to be a part of our journey, we welcome you to explore opportunities at Swyfft!


About the Position:

We are looking for a manual QA Analyst with insurance industry experience to join our growing team.


As a key member of our team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and project stakeholders to deliver impactful change to our policy management system. Your contributions will help us deliver exceptional solutions for our personal insurance business partners, internal users, agents, and valued clients.


If you are a curious, detail-oriented, problem-solver who thrives on breaking things and pushing our software to its limits, this might be the position for you


***Please note that we are unable to provide sponsorship of any kind at this time.


This position is a 100% U.S. based remote opportunity.


Some travel for team meetings and training may be required.


Key Responsibilities: (What you'll be asked to do)

  • Learn and understand our underlying technology to predict and prevent where things are likely to break.
  • Troubleshoot system problems (in test and production) to highlight the root cause of failures.
  • Execute efficient test plans and perform ad-hoc testing as needed.
  • Perform effective data validation and analysis using SQL.
  • Utilize spec docs to create targeted test plans that exhibit the intersection of business needs and likely tech failures.


The Successful Candidate: (What we're looking for)

  • Previous experience as a QA Analyst in the insurance space (small to mid-sized homeowners or commercial insurance carrier is ideal).
  • Proven ability to write effective and detailed test cases and test plans from requirements, user stories, or technical specifications.
  • You understand complex insurance processes enough to know what we need before we even ask for it.
  • Strong understanding of insurance-related technical jargon/lingo well enough to communicate with the developers who are still playing D&D in their parent’s basement every Wednesday night.
  • Deadlines don’t phase you; you’ve already finished the project three days early and can start working on something else.
  • You are an analytical problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced, very collaborative environment.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Oh, and you have to be a reasonably nice person. Life is too short: we want to work with people we like.


Some Requirements:

  • 3+ years as a QA Analyst in the property and casualty insurance space.
  • Hands-on experience with modern test case management tools.
  • Familiarity with interpreting API documentation and testing.


Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or IT is required.


Computer Skills:

  • 3+ years performing testing or other similar tech-related work.
  • 2+ years SQL or similar scripting experience.
  • Coding and troubleshooting experience with our tech stack (.NET/C#/SQL Server).
  • Experience testing different data formats like JSON and XML.


Other:

  • Reliable high-speed internet connectivity required.
  • Designated quiet work from home space.


The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is: $80,000 - $90,000 per year + benefits. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations. This salary range is a good-faith estimate of what Swyfft may pay for this position at the time of posting. Actual compensation may vary based on skills, qualifications, and experience. The range reflects annual compensation (as applicable) and does not include bonuses or other incentives that the company may choose to pay at its sole discretion.


In addition to base compensation Swyfft offers a comprehensive benefit package.


We Have a Great Benefits Package!

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision
  • Short- and Long-Term Disability (Company Paid)
  • Voluntary Long-Term Disability
  • Employee Life & AD&D (Company Paid)
  • Voluntary Employee, Spouse, and Child Life & AD&D
  • Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit FSA, and Healthcare Savings Account (HSA)
  • 401K with a generous matching contribution and no vesting schedule
  • 20 days of PTO annually (prorated based on hire date)
  • Company Paid Holidays and 2 “Choose Your Own Holidays”


It is the policy of Swyfft to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. EOE/AA/M/D/V/F.


If you require accommodations during the application or interview, please contact Human Resources at hr@swyfft.com, and we will make every effort to accommodate your needs.


Please Note: Swyfft is not accepting 3rd party agency resumes for this position, please do not forward resumes to our careers email address or Swyfft employees. Swyfft will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description: About Elligint HealthElligint Health, established in 2024, is leading the charge of innovating healthcare by aligning all stakeholders, delivering intelligent healthcare solutions, and empowering pro-active, whole-person care across the healthcare continuum. Elligint Health integrates vast amounts of data from across the healthcare continuum, delivering intelligence that informs decision-making, enhances care coordination, and improves outcomes. Focused on enabling actionable intervention and whole-person care, Elligint Health helps healthcare organizations navigate complexity, turning insights into strategies that benefit providers, payers, and members and patients alike. With Elligint Health, the future of healthcare is simpler, smarter, and more effective.The PositionPerform Quality Assurance automation testing of web-based applications Design, develop, and execute test script to cover test scenarios based on business requirements, user stories, and functional specificationsCollaborate with QA Director, Test Lead, developers, and other members of the team  Support the ongoing creation and development of approaches to Quality Assurance  Proactively communicate status updates of issues and resolutions to key stakeholders Qualifications3+ years of experience in Quality Assurance with Test Automation expertise (Java/Python/JavaScript or any other programming language) Strong experience with TestRail (or other TMS), issue tracking systems, and related tools Strong communication and interpersonal skills Working knowledge of bug tracking and test case management tools (Jira, TestRail)You have an ownership mentality with a strong bias to action and a preference for being hands-onExpertise with Selenium based automation frameworksCross-browser/platform testing skillsDatabase knowledge(SQL)API testing experienceAbility to learn new technology quicklyCompensationCompetitive salaryPTO and company sick leaveRapidly growing technology company with upside potentialElligint Health is committed to ensuring that information security remains a top priority for everyone. All workers are responsible for the protection of our Information Security, and we take the execution of this seriously. Information Security Policies and procedures details and training will be provided during onboarding.Each candidate will be subject to a drug screening, background check, and reference check before beginning employment. Please note that some of our positions require U.S. citizenship and submission and further approval of “Public Trust” federal clearance.
descriptionHtml:
About Elligint Health

Elligint Health, established in 2024, is leading the charge of innovating healthcare by aligning all stakeholders, delivering intelligent healthcare solutions, and empowering pro-active, whole-person care across the healthcare continuum. Elligint Health integrates vast amounts of data from across the healthcare continuum, delivering intelligence that informs decision-making, enhances care coordination, and improves outcomes. Focused on enabling actionable intervention and whole-person care, Elligint Health helps healthcare organizations navigate complexity, turning insights into strategies that benefit providers, payers, and members and patients alike. With Elligint Health, the future of healthcare is simpler, smarter, and more effective.

The Position

  • Perform Quality Assurance automation testing of web-based applications
  • Design, develop, and execute test script to cover test scenarios based on business requirements, user stories, and functional specifications
  • Collaborate with QA Director, Test Lead, developers, and other members of the team 
  • Support the ongoing creation and development of approaches to Quality Assurance 
  • Proactively communicate status updates of issues and resolutions to key stakeholders

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in Quality Assurance with Test Automation expertise (Java/Python/JavaScript or any other programming language)
  • Strong experience with TestRail (or other TMS), issue tracking systems, and related tools
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Working knowledge of bug tracking and test case management tools (Jira, TestRail)
  • You have an ownership mentality with a strong bias to action and a preference for being hands-on
  • Expertise with Selenium based automation frameworks
  • Cross-browser/platform testing skills
  • Database knowledge(SQL)
  • API testing experience
  • Ability to learn new technology quickly

Compensation

  • Competitive salary
  • PTO and company sick leave
  • Rapidly growing technology company with upside potential

Elligint Health is committed to ensuring that information security remains a top priority for everyone. All workers are responsible for the protection of our Information Security, and we take the execution of this seriously. Information Security Policies and procedures details and training will be provided during onboarding.

Each candidate will be subject to a drug screening, background check, and reference check before beginning employment. Please note that some of our positions require U.S. citizenship and submission and further approval of “Public Trust” federal clearance.

descriptionHtml:
OneTouch Direct is not your typical Call Center. Founded in 1998, we have since grown into one of the most preeminent providers of contact center solutions in the nation. We work with Fortune 500 companies providing useful products and excellent service. We are a seamless extension of our clients while building an internal culture that stands out above the rest.

The Manager, Quality Assurance will oversee the quality assurance team, implementing and managing QA strategies that ensure the delivery of high-quality services to our clients. This role involves establishing quality standards, monitoring compliance, and providing ongoing training and support to improve the performance of call center associates.

  • Lead and manage the Quality Assurance department, including hiring, training, and performance evaluations
  • Develop and implement quality assurance processes and metrics to ensure compliance with policy and standards
  • Monitor and evaluate inbound and outbound customer interactions to ensure adherence to quality standards
  • Analyze performance data and prepare reports on trends and findings for management review
  • Provide coaching and feedback to associates, using monitoring data to highlight areas for improvement
  • Collaborate with team leaders and management to develop training programs based on QA findings
  • Conduct regular calibration sessions to ensure alignment in quality assessment
  • Stay updated on industry best practices and incorporate them into QA strategies
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience in Quality Assurance, preferably in a call center environment
  • Proven leadership experience managing a team of quality assurance professionals
  • Strong knowledge of quality assurance methodologies and best practices
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to develop training programs and provide constructive feedback
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Knowledge of customer service tools and technologies preferred
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
  • Bachelor's degree in a related field is a plus

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Training & Development
  • A positive upbeat work environment
  • Opportunity for professional and personal growth
  • Diverse, welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups

descriptionHtml:
Position: QA Engineer

Compensation: $70 - $90 /hr

Location: Kansas City, Missouri

Inceed has partnered with a great company to help find a skilled QA Engineer to join their team!

Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Join a dynamic team that is committed to delivering high-quality data products and platforms. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a forward-thinking environment where you will play a vital role in ensuring quality assurance across complex technical ecosystems. Embrace the challenge and contribute to innovative solutions that meet business value and technical quality standards.

Key Responsibilities & Duties:

  • Design and implement test strategies for data platforms and APIs.
  • Collaborate with developers to integrate testing into data pipelines.
  • Create, execute, and automate test cases for data validation.
  • Document test results and recommend corrective actions.
  • Manage defect tickets with clear reproduction steps.
  • Perform integration, regression, and performance testing.
  • Build automated testing frameworks for CI/CD pipelines.
  • Validate instrumentation and logging for observability.
  • Participate in Agile ceremonies to enhance delivery workflows.
  • Research and implement new testing technologies.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
  • 4+ years of development or QA testing experience.
  • Strong knowledge of QA methodologies and testing approaches.
  • Experience with test automation frameworks.
  • Proficiency in a programming or scripting language.
  • Familiarity with API testing tools and data platforms.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and agile practices.
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Nice to Have Skills & Experience:

  • Experience with cloud environments like GCP or Snowflake.
  • Familiarity with messaging/streaming platforms like Kafka.
  • Knowledge of application performance monitoring tools.
  • Relevant certifications like ISTQB.

Perks & Benefits:

  • 3 different medical health insurance plans, dental, and vision insurance
  • Voluntary and Long-term disability insurance
  • Paid time off, 401k, and holiday pay
  • Weekly direct deposit or pay card deposit

If you are interested in learning more about the QA Engineer opportunity, please submit your resume for consideration. Our client is unable to provide sponsorship at this time.

We are Inceed, a staffing direct placement firm who believes in the possibility of something better. Our mission is simple: We’re here to help every person, whether client, candidate, or employee, find and secure what’s better for them.

Inceed is an equal opportunity employer. Inceed prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
