descriptionHtml:
Job Title: QA Specialist – Web Testing & Automation



Location: Cupertino, CA (Hybrid – Tues–Thurs onsite, must be open to coming in 5 days/week if needed)



Salary Range: $33/hr W2

(3-month contract, possible extension)




Introduction

Are you passionate about ensuring flawless web experiences across platforms and devices? We’re looking for a meticulous and experienced QA Specialist to support one of our top clients in the advertising and digital media space. This is a fast-paced, collaborative opportunity to work on high-traffic marketing websites used by millions. The ideal candidate has strong manual and automated testing experience, solid HTML/CSS skills, and thrives in cross-functional environments.




Required Skills & Qualifications


  • 2+ years working as a QA Tester, QA Engineer, or Web Developer

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent hands-on experience

  • Strong knowledge of front-end web testing methodologies

  • Hands-on experience with manual and automated test execution

  • Solid understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

  • Experience working in Agile development teams

  • Familiarity with Git, regression testing, and test case documentation

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot errors effectively

  • Knowledge of cross-browser and cross-device testing practices

  • Comfortable testing across MacOS, iOS, Windows, and Android




Preferred Skills & Qualifications


  • Experience testing large-scale marketing websites

  • Exposure to rendering engines and browser quirks

  • Automation experience with UI/UX testing tools

  • Background in executing and refining test plans

  • Working knowledge of modern QA platforms and standards




Day-to-Day Responsibilities


  • Test new and updated web pages and content using manual and automated methods

  • Execute test cases across platforms, analyze results, and validate expected behavior

  • Identify and document bugs in a clear, organized manner

  • Verify feature releases and bug fixes across pre-release environments

  • Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to ensure consistent quality

  • Evaluate front-end code changes (HTML/CSS) and adjust testing strategy as needed

  • Report risk and quality concerns to leads and stakeholders

  • Assist in writing and maintaining test cases




Company Benefits & Culture


  • Work with a highly creative and innovative digital team

  • Hybrid model promoting collaboration, flexibility, and autonomy

  • Fast-paced environment with a clear emphasis on quality and brand consistency

  • Potential for contract extension or further opportunities within our client network




Apply now to join a team that blends cutting-edge digital with large-scale brand presence—and help bring polished, high-impact websites to life.



#CDM #Hybrid
title: QA Specialist

description: Fortune Brands Innovations, Inc. is an industry-leading innovation company focused on creating smarter, safer and more beautiful homes and improving lives. Our driving purpose is that we elevate every life by transforming spaces into havens. We believe our work and our brands can have incredibly positive impacts for not just our business and shareholders, but for people and the planet, too. When you join Fortune Brands, you become part of a high-performing team who are empowered to think big, learn fast and make bold decisions. We support an inclusive and diverse culture where everyone is encouraged and empowered to be their authentic selves, and where our differences and unique perspectives are a key strength. Explore life at Fortune Brands hereJob DescriptionWe are seeking an experienced Sr. QA Engineer to lead black and gray box manual testing efforts for our MasterLock connected Lockout/Tagout (cLOTO) platforms. In this critical role, you will ensure the highest quality and reliability of our web and mobile applications (iOS/Android) as they interact with associated safety devices. Your responsibilities will include designing, developing, and executing comprehensive manual test plans and cases, validating safety-critical workflows, and ensuring compliance with OSHA standards. Collaborating closely with Product, UX, mobile, firmware, backend and automation QA teams, your meticulous approach will directly contribute to the safety and effectiveness of systems used in hazardous industrial environments, safeguarding users who rely on our solutions to isolate hazardous energy sources. POSITION LOCATION: San Francisco, CA or North Olmsted, OH - Hybrid roleEmployment Type: Full-time RESPONSIBLIITIES:Develop and implement comprehensive test plans for web and mobile applications (iOS/Android), prioritizing high-risk LOTO workflows, and conduct QA engineering for native apps, backend systems, and firmware. Identify and create test workflows and scenarios based on product requirements, user stories and technical specifications, transforming them into structured and traceable test plans and test cases in TestRail. Execute thorough tests across various browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) and devices (smartphones, tablets, desktops), covering functional, regression, exploratory, and usability testing, including validating interactions with BLE-enabled smart locks. Conduct scenario-based testing to simulate complete operational procedures to identify potential edge cases and safety concerns. Document defects in a bug tracking system (JIRA) and prioritize defect reports. Organize and drive bug scrub meetings with cross-functional teams for timely resolution. Collaborate with developers, product managers, and UX designers to prioritize bug fixes, review requirements and user stories, and ensure alignment and integration of QA activities. Communicate quality risks and test reports to stakeholders, provide insights during sprint planning and reviews, and actively participate in cross-functional meetings, advocating for quality throughout the software development lifecycle. Organize and provide training for remote support testers, review daily testing reports, plan tester/device allocations, and provide testing strategy and priorities while offering hands-on testing support for project milestones and updates. Foster collaboration with cross-functional teams in an agile/scrum environment, promoting continuous improvement in QA processes, methodologies, and documentation. Stay updated on industry trends and technologies related to manual testing in safety systems, recommending improvements to enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness.   QUALIFICATIONS: Required:Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 6+ years of hands-on grey box manual QA testing experience, focusing on web and native mobile applications (iOS/Android) in Agile/Scrum environments. Proven experience in testing connected devices (IoT) and their software interfaces, including BLE and Wi-Fi technologies, and firmware testing. Strong understanding of client-server architecture, RESTful APIs, web technologies, mobile operating system behavior, Linux/Unix command line tools, Python/shell scripting, and API testing using Postman. Ability to create clear, traceable test cases and defect reports using tools such as Jira and TestRail, along with strong expertise in QA methodologies, processes, and documentation practices. Exceptional analytical skills with keen attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and perform log analysis effectively. Ability to be adaptive and work in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Articulate technical concepts clearly, effectively champion user-experience, and ensure worker safety Preferred:Knowledge of industrial safety practices, including Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures and compliance regulations (e.g., OSHA, ISO 45001). Firmware OTA testing on consumer IoT devices, and manufacturing firmware test support experience. Experience testing systems in regulated environments or safety-critical applications, using BLE, NFC-enabled, Biometric, Wi-Fi enabled locks or other safety devices. Basic SQL skills for database verification and familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for log parsing. QualificationsRequired:Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. 6+ years of hands-on grey box manual QA testing experience, focusing on web and native mobile applications (iOS/Android) in Agile/Scrum environments. Proven experience in testing connected devices (IoT) and their software interfaces, including BLE and Wi-Fi technologies, and firmware testing. Strong understanding of client-server architecture, RESTful APIs, web technologies, mobile operating system behavior, Linux/Unix command line tools, Python/shell scripting, and API testing using Postman. Ability to create clear, traceable test cases and defect reports using tools such as Jira and TestRail, along with strong expertise in QA methodologies, processes, and documentation practices. Exceptional analytical skills with keen attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and perform log analysis effectively. Ability to be adaptive and work in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Articulate technical concepts clearly, effectively champion user-experience, and ensure worker safety Preferred:Knowledge of industrial safety practices, including Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures and compliance regulations (e.g., OSHA, ISO 45001). Firmware OTA testing on consumer IoT devices, and manufacturing firmware test support experience. Experience testing systems in regulated environments or safety-critical applications, using BLE, NFC-enabled, Biometric, Wi-Fi enabled locks or other safety devices. Basic SQL skills for database verification and familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for log parsing. Additional InformationAdditional Information:  Fortune Brands believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is Hiring Pay Range: $100,000 USD - $165,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based sales incentive plan. At Fortune Brands, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous Employee Resource Groups to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.Fortune Brands is a brand, innovation and channel leader focused on exciting, supercharged categories in the home products, security and commercial building markets. Our portfolio of brands includes Moen, House of Rohl, Aqualisa, SpringWell, Therma-Tru, Larson, Fiberon, Master Lock, SentrySafe and Yale residential.Fortune Brands is headquartered in Deerfield, Illinois and trades on the NYSE as FBIN Equal Employment Opportunity:FBIN is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other legally protected characteristic. Reasonable Accommodations:FBIN is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at fbinleave.fbhs@fbin.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Resumes submitted to this email address will not be responded to.To protect yourself from fraudulent job postings or recruitment scams, please note that FBIN job postings are exclusively hosted on our careers page at www.fbin.com/careers>.
descriptionHtml:
Fortune Brands Innovations, Inc. is an industry-leading innovation company focused on creating smarter, safer and more beautiful homes and improving lives. Our driving purpose is that we elevate every life by transforming spaces into havens. We believe our work and our brands can have incredibly positive impacts for not just our business and shareholders, but for people and the planet, too. When you join Fortune Brands, you become part of a high-performing team who are empowered to think big, learn fast and make bold decisions. We support an inclusive and diverse culture where everyone is encouraged and empowered to be their authentic selves, and where our differences and unique perspectives are a key strength. Explore life at Fortune Brands here



Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Sr. QA Engineer to lead black and gray box manual testing efforts for our MasterLock connected Lockout/Tagout (cLOTO) platforms. In this critical role, you will ensure the highest quality and reliability of our web and mobile applications (iOS/Android) as they interact with associated safety devices. Your responsibilities will include designing, developing, and executing comprehensive manual test plans and cases, validating safety-critical workflows, and ensuring compliance with OSHA standards. Collaborating closely with Product, UX, mobile, firmware, backend and automation QA teams, your meticulous approach will directly contribute to the safety and effectiveness of systems used in hazardous industrial environments, safeguarding users who rely on our solutions to isolate hazardous energy sources.



POSITION LOCATION: San Francisco, CA or North Olmsted, OH - Hybrid role

Employment Type: Full-time



RESPONSIBLIITIES:

  • Develop and implement comprehensive test plans for web and mobile applications (iOS/Android), prioritizing high-risk LOTO workflows, and conduct QA engineering for native apps, backend systems, and firmware.
  • Identify and create test workflows and scenarios based on product requirements, user stories and technical specifications, transforming them into structured and traceable test plans and test cases in TestRail.
  • Execute thorough tests across various browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) and devices (smartphones, tablets, desktops), covering functional, regression, exploratory, and usability testing, including validating interactions with BLE-enabled smart locks.
  • Conduct scenario-based testing to simulate complete operational procedures to identify potential edge cases and safety concerns.
  • Document defects in a bug tracking system (JIRA) and prioritize defect reports.
  • Organize and drive bug scrub meetings with cross-functional teams for timely resolution.
  • Collaborate with developers, product managers, and UX designers to prioritize bug fixes, review requirements and user stories, and ensure alignment and integration of QA activities.
  • Communicate quality risks and test reports to stakeholders, provide insights during sprint planning and reviews, and actively participate in cross-functional meetings, advocating for quality throughout the software development lifecycle.
  • Organize and provide training for remote support testers, review daily testing reports, plan tester/device allocations, and provide testing strategy and priorities while offering hands-on testing support for project milestones and updates.
  • Foster collaboration with cross-functional teams in an agile/scrum environment, promoting continuous improvement in QA processes, methodologies, and documentation.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and technologies related to manual testing in safety systems, recommending improvements to enhance testing efficiency and effectiveness.





QUALIFICATIONS:



Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6+ years of hands-on grey box manual QA testing experience, focusing on web and native mobile applications (iOS/Android) in Agile/Scrum environments.
  • Proven experience in testing connected devices (IoT) and their software interfaces, including BLE and Wi-Fi technologies, and firmware testing.
  • Strong understanding of client-server architecture, RESTful APIs, web technologies, mobile operating system behavior, Linux/Unix command line tools, Python/shell scripting, and API testing using Postman.
  • Ability to create clear, traceable test cases and defect reports using tools such as Jira and TestRail, along with strong expertise in QA methodologies, processes, and documentation practices.
  • Exceptional analytical skills with keen attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and perform log analysis effectively. Ability to be adaptive and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Articulate technical concepts clearly, effectively champion user-experience, and ensure worker safety



Preferred:

  • Knowledge of industrial safety practices, including Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures and compliance regulations (e.g., OSHA, ISO 45001).
  • Firmware OTA testing on consumer IoT devices, and manufacturing firmware test support experience.
  • Experience testing systems in regulated environments or safety-critical applications, using BLE, NFC-enabled, Biometric, Wi-Fi enabled locks or other safety devices.
  • Basic SQL skills for database verification and familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for log parsing.

Qualifications

Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6+ years of hands-on grey box manual QA testing experience, focusing on web and native mobile applications (iOS/Android) in Agile/Scrum environments.
  • Proven experience in testing connected devices (IoT) and their software interfaces, including BLE and Wi-Fi technologies, and firmware testing.
  • Strong understanding of client-server architecture, RESTful APIs, web technologies, mobile operating system behavior, Linux/Unix command line tools, Python/shell scripting, and API testing using Postman.
  • Ability to create clear, traceable test cases and defect reports using tools such as Jira and TestRail, along with strong expertise in QA methodologies, processes, and documentation practices.
  • Exceptional analytical skills with keen attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and perform log analysis effectively. Ability to be adaptive and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Articulate technical concepts clearly, effectively champion user-experience, and ensure worker safety



Preferred:

  • Knowledge of industrial safety practices, including Lockout/Tagout (LOTO) procedures and compliance regulations (e.g., OSHA, ISO 45001).
  • Firmware OTA testing on consumer IoT devices, and manufacturing firmware test support experience.
  • Experience testing systems in regulated environments or safety-critical applications, using BLE, NFC-enabled, Biometric, Wi-Fi enabled locks or other safety devices.
  • Basic SQL skills for database verification and familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Shell) for log parsing.

Additional Information

Additional Information:







Fortune Brands believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is Hiring Pay Range: $100,000 USD - $165,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based sales incentive plan.



At Fortune Brands, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous Employee Resource Groups to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.

Fortune Brands is a brand, innovation and channel leader focused on exciting, supercharged categories in the home products, security and commercial building markets. Our portfolio of brands includes Moen, House of Rohl, Aqualisa, SpringWell, Therma-Tru, Larson, Fiberon, Master Lock, SentrySafe and Yale residential.

Fortune Brands is headquartered in Deerfield, Illinois and trades on the NYSE as FBIN



Equal Employment Opportunity:

FBIN is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other legally protected characteristic.



Reasonable Accommodations:

FBIN is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at fbinleave.fbhs@fbin.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Resumes submitted to this email address will not be responded to.

To protect yourself from fraudulent job postings or recruitment scams, please note that FBIN job postings are exclusively hosted on our careers page at www.fbin.com/careers>.

descriptionHtml:
The Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist is responsible for ensuring that products, processes, and systems meet established quality standards and regulatory requirements. This role involves developing, implementing, and maintaining quality systems, conducting inspections and audits, analyzing data, and driving continuous improvement across operations.


Key Responsibilities

· Champion and uphold the company’s values, vision, mission, and quality policy in all activities.

· Develop, implement, and maintain quality assurance systems, processes, and documentation to ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and internal controls.

· Conduct inspections, audits, and reviews in accordance with industry standards (e.g., ISO, ITAR) and regulatory requirements.

· Investigate customer complaints and product nonconformances; manage RMAs, NCRs, product holds, and defective material disposition while leading root cause analysis and implementing corrective and preventive actions.

· Collect, analyze, and report quality metrics while maintaining accurate records, certifications, and documentation.

· Own and maintain Quality Management Systems, including ISO compliance, customer audits, and regulatory audits.

· Serve as the primary point of contact with customers, suppliers, and regulatory agencies on quality-related matters.

· Partner with production, engineering, and supply chain teams to uphold quality standards.

· Develop and deliver training for new and current employees on quality standards and inspection practices, including methodologies, blueprints, techniques, and defect identification.

· Lead process improvement initiatives using Six Sigma, Lean, or Kaizen methodologies.

· Provide inspection support during peak workloads or staff absences to ensure uninterrupted operations and compliance.

· Oversee incoming material inspections, including monthly and annual audits.

· Perform on-site calibrations of tools and instruments according to documented procedures and industry standards; coordinate and track external calibrations to ensure all equipment remains within its calibration cycle, maintaining accurate and complete records of procedures, results, and maintenance history.


Qualifications/Education/Skills Required:

· Bachelor's degree in Quality, Engineering, Manufacturing, or related field preferred.

· Strong working knowledge of quality systems and standards (ISO 9001).

· Minimum 3-5 years of experience in quality assurance, with at least 2 years in a management or leadership role.

· Proven expertise in diverse manufacturing areas, including punch and die tooling, medical device production, and precision engineering.

· Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

· Experience with audits, root cause analysis, and quality tools (FMEA, SPC, MSA, PPAP, 8D, etc.).

· Proficiency with quality management software, ERP systems, and Microsoft Office.

· Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

· Ability to work in an office and manufacturing environment

· May require occasional travel to suppliers or customers.

· Able to stand, walk, and perform inspections on the production floor.


Work Environment:

Manufacturing floor environments

Controlled temperature environments

Travel to client sites, conventions and trade shows


Expected Hours of Work: This is a Full-Time salary position required to work Monday through Friday, with occasional overtime as needed.


Travel:

Up to 10%

descriptionHtml:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a QA Manager in Boston, MA. Responsibilities:

  • QA Manager will define and maintain QA strategy, testing methods, and best practices
  • Lead the QA team and oversee quality processes across development
  • Ensure strong business understanding for thorough test coverage
  • Manage requirement traceability and regression test suites
  • Assign and track QA tasks to ensure high-quality output
  • Monitor QA metrics and drive improvements
  • Facilitate daily stand-ups and support team development
  • Report test status, flag risks, and escalate defects
  • As a QA Manager, you will coordinate with internal/external teams to resolve issues
  • Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to uphold quality
  • Address project issues and assess go-live readiness

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Engineering, Technology or related field
  • Minimum 8 years of IT QA experience
  • Minimum 5 years of experience managing a QA team
  • Experience with MS Office 365, ALM, JIRA, QA automation, Testing methodologies and other QA tools
  • Strong organizational, analytical, and presentation skills

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

descriptionHtml:
We are looking for an experienced QA Testing Analyst to join our team in Columbus, Ohio. In this long-term contract role, you will take the lead in ensuring the quality and reliability of software systems by overseeing testing processes and documentation deliverables. You will collaborate across teams to drive test strategies, manage bug triage, and ensure successful implementation of testing plans while maintaining high standards of accuracy and efficiency.

Responsibilities:
• Develop and manage test strategies, plans, suites, and cases to ensure comprehensive coverage and alignment with project requirements.
• Execute and oversee testing processes, including bug tracking, triage, and resolution, while coordinating with vendors and impacted teams.
• Monitor and report testing metrics, risks, blockers, and readiness to ensure project progress and quality assurance.
• Facilitate meetings such as grooming sessions, bug reviews, and triage discussions to enhance collaboration and problem-solving.
• Prepare lab environments by collaborating with development leads to ensure readiness for testing.
• Coach and mentor QA team members and coordinate testing efforts with vendors and cross-functional teams.
• Maintain team boards and dashboards to track project progress and testing outcomes.
• Deliver comprehensive test documentation, including traceability reports, bug summaries, and execution outcomes.
• Support production implementation and validation processes to ensure successful software deployment.
• Conduct regression testing and establish validation plans to maintain software quality across releases.
• Proven experience in QA testing, documentation, and managing complex testing deliverables.
• Strong expertise in bug tracking, triage, and prioritization using enterprise standards.
• Excellent communication and facilitation skills to coordinate between teams and vendors.
• Demonstrated ability to create dashboards, track metrics, and maintain project status reporting.
• Familiarity with Agile methodology and change management processes.
• Proficiency in developing validation plans and regression testing strategies.
• Knowledge of automation tools and techniques to enhance testing efficiency.
• Ability to act as a subject matter expert for high-complexity projects or systems.
Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.



Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. descriptionHtml:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

As a General QA (AI Trainer), you will help ensure the quality of prompts and outputs by reviewing tasks for language quality, guideline accuracy, and consistency. You will serve as the final quality check before work is sent to the client.

Responsibilities:

  • Prompt & Output Review: Evaluate AI prompts and responses for clarity, correctness, fairness, and compliance with guidelines. Provide feedback to ensure outputs meet high-quality standards.
  • Content Refinement: Identify issues such as ambiguity, factual errors, formatting inconsistencies, or bias in AI outputs, and suggest improvements.
  • Auditing Work: Review tasks completed by other contributors, ensuring they follow project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback and edit content as needed to improve quality.
  • Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
  • Guideline Application: Apply quality rubrics consistently to ensure outputs align with established standards

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree n any discipline (no specific field required)
  • You have at least 3-5 years of professional experience in a role requiring attention to detail, critical thinking, or quality review
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $30/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
title: Freelance General - QA / AI Trainer

description: What are we building?Hard Rock Digital is a team focused on becoming the best online sportsbook, casino, and social gaming company in the world. We’re building a team that resonates passion for learning, operating and building new products and technologies for millions of consumers. We care about each customer's interaction, experience, behavior, and insight and strive to ensure we’re always acting authentically. Rooted in the kindred spirits of Hard Rock and the Seminole Tribe of Florida, the new Hard Rock Digital taps a brand known the world over as the leader in gaming, entertainment, and hospitality. We’re taking that foundation of success and bringing it to the digital space — ready to join us? What’s the position?As a CRM QA Coordinator within our CRM Sports and Casino team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and flawless execution of all CRM campaigns. This role demands a detail-oriented and process-driven professional who can rigorously test and validate user journeys, email content, push notifications, and promotional bonus configurations before launch.You'll act as the final checkpoint before campaigns go live—ensuring a seamless, on-brand experience for our customers and protecting the business from errors that could impact revenue or customer trust. Key Responsibilities:Campaign Quality AssuranceReview and test multi-channel CRM campaigns (email, push notifications, SMS, in-app) for accuracy in content, personalization, segmentation, and delivery timing.Validate correct language, and design alignment across all communications.Ensure campaign links, tracking tags, and dynamic content behave as expected across platforms and devices. User Journey ValidationThoroughly test automated customer lifecycle journeys (e.g., onboarding, retention, reactivation) in CRM tools and ensure proper trigger logic and flow.Monitor entry/exit criteria, conditions, and wait times to validate user movement through journeys.Identify edge cases, broken logic, or conflicting messages that could disrupt the customer experience. Bonus & Promotion Setup VerificationValidate CRM campaign bonus setups and configurations to ensure correct reward logic, eligibility rules, and payout mechanics.Collaborate with CRM Operations, and Promotional teams to ensure bonus descriptions and T&Cs match the technical setup.Test offers across sportsbook and casino verticals, including free bets, deposit matches, and free spins. Testing & TroubleshootingOwn and execute end-to-end QA test cases prior to campaigns going live..Use staging environments, preview tools, and test user accounts to simulate customer experiences.Proactively flag bugs and inconsistencies, and coordinate with CRM Ops and Tech teams to resolve them. Documentation & ImprovementsMaintain campaign QA documentation and checklists to ensure consistent standards.Help develop and continuously improve QA workflows and best practices for campaign testing.What are we looking for?1–2 years experience in CRM, QA, or Marketing Operations, ideally in online gaming, betting, or a similar regulated environment.Strong understanding of customer lifecycle campaigns and marketing automation tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Optimove).Familiarity with QA methodologies and testing best practices.Experience testing and troubleshooting email, push notifications, and promotional journeys.Attention to detail, with excellent organizational and communication skills.Comfortable with tools like Jira,Monday, Confluence, or similar for bug tracking and documentation.Knowledge of bonus logic in gaming (free bets, spins, wagering requirements) is highly desirable.Understanding of regulatory standards in iGaming jurisdictions (e.g., GDPR, RG requirements) is a plus. What’s in it for you?We offer our employees more than just competitive compensation. Our team benefits include:Competitive pay and benefitsFlexible vacation allowanceStartup culture backed by a secure, global brand Roster of UniquesWe care deeply about every interaction our customers have with us, and trust and empower our staff to own and drive their experience. Our vision for our business and customers is built on fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where regardless of background or beliefs you feel able to be authentic and bring all your talent into play. We want to celebrate you being you (we are an equal opportunities employer).
descriptionHtml:
What are we building?

Hard Rock Digital is a team focused on becoming the best online sportsbook, casino, and social gaming company in the world. We’re building a team that resonates passion for learning, operating and building new products and technologies for millions of consumers. We care about each customer's interaction, experience, behavior, and insight and strive to ensure we’re always acting authentically.

Rooted in the kindred spirits of Hard Rock and the Seminole Tribe of Florida, the new Hard Rock Digital taps a brand known the world over as the leader in gaming, entertainment, and hospitality. We’re taking that foundation of success and bringing it to the digital space — ready to join us?

What’s the position?

As a CRM QA Coordinator within our CRM Sports and Casino team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and flawless execution of all CRM campaigns. This role demands a detail-oriented and process-driven professional who can rigorously test and validate user journeys, email content, push notifications, and promotional bonus configurations before launch.

You'll act as the final checkpoint before campaigns go live—ensuring a seamless, on-brand experience for our customers and protecting the business from errors that could impact revenue or customer trust.

Key Responsibilities:

Campaign Quality Assurance

  • Review and test multi-channel CRM campaigns (email, push notifications, SMS, in-app) for accuracy in content, personalization, segmentation, and delivery timing.
  • Validate correct language, and design alignment across all communications.
  • Ensure campaign links, tracking tags, and dynamic content behave as expected across platforms and devices.

User Journey Validation

  • Thoroughly test automated customer lifecycle journeys (e.g., onboarding, retention, reactivation) in CRM tools and ensure proper trigger logic and flow.
  • Monitor entry/exit criteria, conditions, and wait times to validate user movement through journeys.
  • Identify edge cases, broken logic, or conflicting messages that could disrupt the customer experience.

Bonus & Promotion Setup Verification

  • Validate CRM campaign bonus setups and configurations to ensure correct reward logic, eligibility rules, and payout mechanics.
  • Collaborate with CRM Operations, and Promotional teams to ensure bonus descriptions and T&Cs match the technical setup.
  • Test offers across sportsbook and casino verticals, including free bets, deposit matches, and free spins.

Testing & Troubleshooting

  • Own and execute end-to-end QA test cases prior to campaigns going live..
  • Use staging environments, preview tools, and test user accounts to simulate customer experiences.
  • Proactively flag bugs and inconsistencies, and coordinate with CRM Ops and Tech teams to resolve them.

Documentation & Improvements

  • Maintain campaign QA documentation and checklists to ensure consistent standards.
  • Help develop and continuously improve QA workflows and best practices for campaign testing.


What are we looking for?

  • 1–2 years experience in CRM, QA, or Marketing Operations, ideally in online gaming, betting, or a similar regulated environment.
  • Strong understanding of customer lifecycle campaigns and marketing automation tools (e.g., Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Optimove).
  • Familiarity with QA methodologies and testing best practices.
  • Experience testing and troubleshooting email, push notifications, and promotional journeys.
  • Attention to detail, with excellent organizational and communication skills.
  • Comfortable with tools like Jira,Monday, Confluence, or similar for bug tracking and documentation.
  • Knowledge of bonus logic in gaming (free bets, spins, wagering requirements) is highly desirable.
  • Understanding of regulatory standards in iGaming jurisdictions (e.g., GDPR, RG requirements) is a plus.

What’s in it for you?

We offer our employees more than just competitive compensation. Our team benefits include:

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Flexible vacation allowance
  • Startup culture backed by a secure, global brand

Roster of Uniques

We care deeply about every interaction our customers have with us, and trust and empower our staff to own and drive their experience. Our vision for our business and customers is built on fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where regardless of background or beliefs you feel able to be authentic and bring all your talent into play. We want to celebrate you being you (we are an equal opportunities employer).

descriptionHtml:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills.

As a General QA (AI Trainer), you will help ensure the quality of prompts and outputs by reviewing tasks for language quality, guideline accuracy, and consistency. You will serve as the final quality check before work is sent to the client.

Responsibilities:

  • Prompt & Output Review: Evaluate AI prompts and responses for clarity, correctness, fairness, and compliance with guidelines. Provide feedback to ensure outputs meet high-quality standards.
  • Content Refinement: Identify issues such as ambiguity, factual errors, formatting inconsistencies, or bias in AI outputs, and suggest improvements.
  • Auditing Work: Review tasks completed by other contributors, ensuring they follow project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback and edit content as needed to improve quality.
  • Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
  • Guideline Application: Apply quality rubrics consistently to ensure outputs align with established standards

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree n any discipline (no specific field required)
  • You have at least 3-5 years of professional experience in a role requiring attention to detail, critical thinking, or quality review
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $30/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
title: Freelance General - QA / AI Trainer

descriptionHtml:
Quality Assurance (QA) Associate


Job Summary

The Quality Assurance Associate is responsible for performing activities related to the support and execution of the Quality Management program (QMP). They will maintain the QMP to ensure high quality services by reviewing, implementing, and updating MDI processes, policies, and procedures. They are expected to review, monitor, and manage existing quality systems, and help identify and implement opportunities for continuous process improvements at Machaon Diagnostics. They will work closely with the clinical reference laboratory, clinical research, and administrative teams to ensure adherence and compliance with laboratory and industry regulations.




Responsibilities of Quality Assurance Associate

1.     Review and approve controlled documents, including SOPs, policies, job aids, and forms.

2.     Manage non-conformance event reporting, assist with root cause analysis, and support corrective and preventive action (CAPA) planning.

3.     Support document control processes and compliance programs, including:

·        Training and competency management

·        Method validation and proficiency testing

·        Equipment qualification and preventive maintenance

·        Environmental monitoring

4.     Participate in internal and external audits and inspections; assist with preparing responses to findings.

5.     Conduct inspection-readiness activities to maintain ongoing compliance.

6.     Monitor compliance with internal quality management systems and regulatory requirements, including but not limited to: CAP, CLIA, FDA, NYS CLEP, GLP, GCP, GCLP, GMP, HIPAA, GDPR, CLSI, and ISO.

7.     Recommend and implement process improvements to enhance quality and efficiency.

8.     Provide support on special projects and other QA-related initiatives, as assigned.


Minimum Position Requirements:

• California Requirement: Meets the qualification requirements listed in the CA Business and professions Code Section 1200-1213.

• Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Science (Biology, Chemistry, or a related scientific field)

• Experience: At least 1 year of experience in Quality Assurance; prior work in a regulated laboratory or research environment strongly desired.

• Knowledge: Familiarity with regulatory standards and quality management systems.

 Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to recognize problems, troubleshoot effectively, and propose solutions. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams. Experience with MediaLab Document Control strongly desired.

• Special Skills/Equipment: Scientific background and mathematical proficiency required. Must be able to communicate clearly and effectively in person and over the phone.


Please send resumes to Delanda@Machaondiagnostics.com
title: Quality Assurance Associate

description: IXL Learning, developer of personalized learning products used by millions of people globally, is seeking an Associate QA Analyst focused on UI and front end testing. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology and education with an ability to work closely with our product managers and engineers to develop and execute test strategies for a variety of exciting new features. There are QA job openings on several teams, including mobile apps, IXL web, and business tools.This is a full-time position in our Raleigh, NC area office. The work schedule for this role is Monday-Friday in the office with the option to work from home one day per week.What You'll Be DoingEnsure quality on our front-end web applications with a strong focus on UI testingReview business requirements and develop test plans, test cases, test estimations, and test execution reportsPerform functionality, regression, integration, UI, smoke, exploratory, stress and performance testingManage all communications related to QA status on a daily basis and report potential risks during all stages of development lifecycleWork closely with development and product teams to resolve any issues that arise out of the testing processAnalyze test results and facilitate resolution of issuesIterate on existing testing processes and standards to improve efficiency and accuracyWhat We're Looking ForBA/BS degree requiredAbility to work both independently and on a wide variety of teamsPassion for making bullet-proof applications and improving education through technologySelf-motivated, detail oriented, proactive and collaborativeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsKnowledge of JIRA, Unix, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, source control, and mobile device development is a plusAbout IXL LearningIXL Learning is the country's largest EdTech company. We reach millions of learners through our diverse range of products. For example:1 in 4 students in the United States uses IXL.comRosetta Stone provides an immersive learning experience for 25 languagesWyzant is the nation's largest community of tutors, covering 300+ subjectsTeachers Pay Teachers (TPT) is a comprehensive marketplace for millions of educator-created resourcesOur mission is to create innovative products that will make a real, positive difference for learners and educators and we're looking for passionate, mission-minded people to join us in achieving this goal. We have a unique culture at IXL that fosters collaboration and the open exchange of ideas. We value our team and treat one another with kindness and respect. We approach our work with passion, tenacity, and authenticity. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions and we are eager to have you join our team.At IXL, we value diversity in age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, political and religious beliefs, and life experience, and we are proud to promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. descriptionHtml:
IXL Learning, developer of personalized learning products used by millions of people globally, is seeking an Associate QA Analyst focused on UI and front end testing. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology and education with an ability to work closely with our product managers and engineers to develop and execute test strategies for a variety of exciting new features. There are QA job openings on several teams, including mobile apps, IXL web, and business tools.

This is a full-time position in our Raleigh, NC area office. The work schedule for this role is Monday-Friday in the office with the option to work from home one day per week.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Ensure quality on our front-end web applications with a strong focus on UI testing
  • Review business requirements and develop test plans, test cases, test estimations, and test execution reports
  • Perform functionality, regression, integration, UI, smoke, exploratory, stress and performance testing
  • Manage all communications related to QA status on a daily basis and report potential risks during all stages of development lifecycle
  • Work closely with development and product teams to resolve any issues that arise out of the testing process
  • Analyze test results and facilitate resolution of issues
  • Iterate on existing testing processes and standards to improve efficiency and accuracy

What We're Looking For

  • BA/BS degree required
  • Ability to work both independently and on a wide variety of teams
  • Passion for making bullet-proof applications and improving education through technology
  • Self-motivated, detail oriented, proactive and collaborative
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Knowledge of JIRA, Unix, SQL, JavaScript, CSS, source control, and mobile device development is a plus

About IXL Learning

IXL Learning is the country's largest EdTech company. We reach millions of learners through our diverse range of products. For example:

  • 1 in 4 students in the United States uses IXL.com
  • Rosetta Stone provides an immersive learning experience for 25 languages
  • Wyzant is the nation's largest community of tutors, covering 300+ subjects
  • Teachers Pay Teachers (TPT) is a comprehensive marketplace for millions of educator-created resources

Our mission is to create innovative products that will make a real, positive difference for learners and educators and we're looking for passionate, mission-minded people to join us in achieving this goal. We have a unique culture at IXL that fosters collaboration and the open exchange of ideas. We value our team and treat one another with kindness and respect. We approach our work with passion, tenacity, and authenticity. We find it immensely satisfying to develop products that impact the lives of millions and we are eager to have you join our team.

At IXL, we value diversity in age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, political and religious beliefs, and life experience, and we are proud to promote a work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work. IXL Learning is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

descriptionHtml:
The Quality Assurance Engineer will support the Safety & Mission Assurance Services (SMAS) contract at the NASA Space Launch System Liquid Engine, Resident Management Office located in West Palm Beach, FL.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Perform expert level QA inspection and inline assessment on critical flight hardware with zero escapes.

  • Provide expert level QA knowledge in identifying hardware risk and mitigation solutions.

  • Proficient in the collection, management, and analysis of quality data.

  • Provide support on all quality matters to including Quality Plans, Surveillance Plans Inspection Instructions, First Article Inspections, Nonconformance Resolutions, and Auditing.

  • Other duties as assigned.




REQUIRED:


This position has been posted at multiple levels (must meet minimum level indicated). Depending on the candidate's experience, requirements, and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.





  • This position requires US Citizenship due to the sensitivity of customer related information.

  • Requires a bachelor's degree in engineering or related field.

  • Must have 10+ years of recent and related work experience.

  • In lieu of degree: Candidates with 14+ years of recent and related experience will be considered.




DESIRED:



  • AS9100 auditor or lead auditor experience/certification.

  • Supply chain management experience with the ability to travel to critical suppliers.

  • Material Review Board experience.




WORK LOCATION:



  • This position is located onsite.

  • This position offers a 9/80, every other Friday off or 4/10 schedule.

  • Situational telework may be authorized.

  • This position may require second and third shift coverage with some weekends.

  • This position may require some travel.




BACKGROUND INVESTIGATIONS REQUIRED:


All Bastion employees must be able to pass a national agency check, some positions require a clearance and will require an extensive background verification/check process.




DRUG AND ALCOHOL SCREENING REQUIRED:


All Bastion employees must be able to pass pre-employment drug screen; some contracts require participation in periodic random drug and alcohol screening programs.




STANDARD BASTION REQUIREMENTS:



  • Must have experience with Microsoft Office Suite.

  • All of Bastion's employees must be team players.

  • Able to communicate effectively, verbally and in written form, with internal and external customers.

  • Able to follow company programs, processes, procedures, practices, requirements, goals, and objectives.

  • Must have a strong work ethic and must be safety culture oriented.

  • Must be organized with good time management skills.

  • Generally, an office environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on the task.

  • Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods (90% of the time).

  • May require lifting and carrying up to 25 lbs. (5% of the time).

  • Regular attendance in accordance with an established work schedule is critical.

  • Ability to work outside normal schedule and adjust schedule to meet peak periods and surge requirements.




BASTION BENEFITS:


Bastion offers a wide range of benefits for their full-time employees; medical, prescription, dental, vision, AD&D, disability benefits, life insurance, retirement 401k, vacation, sick pay, holidays, and flexible work schedules (when available). We also support career advancement through professional training and development.




ABOUT BASTION:


Bastion offers career opportunities with competitive benefits, exciting possibilities for advancement, and an exceptional work environment; the well-being of our employees is a priority, and our flexibility allows our employees a great work life balance. Our culture is based on strong business ethics, integrity, and professionalism. Our team members are known for their initiative and high-quality work. When it comes to our employees, we value, respect, and help them grow in their careers.




WORKPLACE EXCELLENCE:


At Bastion, we are passionate about our people and our safety culture. We are committed to a journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company, that philosophy fosters an environment of collaboration across cultures. Individual thoughts, opinions, and perspectives bring value and help us develop solutions for challenging problems, they make us more inventive, and more resilient.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.




Bastion participates in e-Verify.

descriptionHtml:
USC AND GC Only

W2 ONLY

Description:

• Strong experience on Automation using Selenium Java, Rest Assured, ReadyAPI and relevant Web UI and mobile automation tools experience.

• Experience on usage of swagger documentation for API validations, REST API Testing and Automation

• Strong Knowledge and ability to code in various programming languages (preferably in Java), JavaScript, SQL, etc to automate tests for the full solution stack (UI, App Layer, REST API, Web Service)

• Design and develop automated test framework/scripts for UI using Selenium and for REST APIs using Rest Assured and TestNG.

• Integrate automated test suites with CI/CD pipelines using tools like Bamboo and Git Hub manage source code using Stash (Bitbucket).

• Design and develop automated test framework/scripts for UI using java Selenium and for REST APIs using Rest Assured and TestNG and familiar with Page object model

• Familiarity with Docker source code using Stash (Bitbucket).

• Experience in Could Testing and mobile automation testing(ios and android devices)

• Collaborate with developers, QA analysts, and product managers to understand requirements and test coverage needs.

• Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.

• Strong debugging and problem-solving skills.

• I participate in test planning, test case design, defect reporting, and root cause analysis using JIRA.

• Contribute to Enterprise Test Automation Frameworks when needed

• Provide accurate estimates for test strategy, design, and execution work

• Document, communicate, and escalate test results and defects

• Identify and document bugs clearly and concisely; validate bug fixes.

• As needed, coordinate activities between the US and remote testing teams

• Build and implement SQL queries and validate databases using an automation tool

• Critical thinking to translate sophisticated application flows to test cases

• Data-driven, with strong problem-solving skills with analytical capabilities to be able to support theories/solutions using underlying data

• Knowledge of Cloud-based Web Applications Architecture

• Knowledge of deployment technologies with emphasis on AWS Cloud

• Experience using the Selenium Grid for parallel execution of Test Cases in Multiple Browsers

• Proven experience within test automation development, using frameworks and tools like Junit, TestNG, Appium, Cucumber, Postman as well as REST/JSON APIs

• Knowledge of Extent Reports 2.0, Eclipse IDE, IntiliJ and Java for developing the Automation Scripts

• Experience in developing Feature Files using Gherkins language for the BDD

• Detailed understanding of concurrency, threading, algorithms, and data structures

• Front End UI experience in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

• Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

• Experience on Kafka topics and consumer validations.
title: Software Quality Analyst

description: Job Title: QA Senior AdvisorJob Location: Morris Plains, NJ (Hybrid - 3 days onsite)# Positions: 3Employment Type: C2HDuration: Long TermKey Technology: QA, Leadership, NCPDP, PBMJob Responsibilities:Acquire knowledge of existing applications, business process flow and project requirement. Perform as SME guiding QA teams. Drive end-to-end testing processes including functional, integration and regression testing. Lead, manage, and mentor QA teams, fostering a high-performance testing culture. Ensure adherence to quality standards, best practices, and compliance requirements. Champion continuous improvement in QA processes through training, tools, and innovation. Skills and Experience Required:Required10+ years of QA experience and 4+ years of working as a QA lead with a proven track record of driving QA programs with multiple QA end-to-end testing teams particularly in coordination with multiple existing teams of developers and product owners. Experienced in working as QA lead on projects involving NCPDP formats including D0 and F6 formats. Strong ability to lead through influence across matrixed organizations, aligning stakeholders without direct authority. Familiarity with PBM products, end-to-end business process flow, including regulatory, privacy, and interoperability considerations. Excellent communication, prioritization, and execution skills. descriptionHtml:
Job Title: QA Senior Advisor

Job Location: Morris Plains, NJ (Hybrid - 3 days onsite)

# Positions: 3

Employment Type: C2H

Duration: Long Term

Key Technology: QA, Leadership, NCPDP, PBM

Job Responsibilities:

  • Acquire knowledge of existing applications, business process flow and project requirement.
  • Perform as SME guiding QA teams.
  • Drive end-to-end testing processes including functional, integration and regression testing.
  • Lead, manage, and mentor QA teams, fostering a high-performance testing culture.
  • Ensure adherence to quality standards, best practices, and compliance requirements.
  • Champion continuous improvement in QA processes through training, tools, and innovation.

Skills and Experience Required:

Required

  • 10+ years of QA experience and 4+ years of working as a QA lead with a proven track record of driving QA programs with multiple QA end-to-end testing teams particularly in coordination with multiple existing teams of developers and product owners.
  • Experienced in working as QA lead on projects involving NCPDP formats including D0 and F6 formats.
  • Strong ability to lead through influence across matrixed organizations, aligning stakeholders without direct authority.
  • Familiarity with PBM products, end-to-end business process flow, including regulatory, privacy, and interoperability considerations.
  • Excellent communication, prioritization, and execution skills.

Desired:

  • Background in PBM domain, especially in Claims processing, integration with external entities, NCPDP formats.
  • Strong systems thinking with the ability to balance near-term delivery with long-term scalability.
  • Comfort working in ambiguous environments with evolving business and technical constraints

descriptionHtml:
Description

Welcome to Interclypse, where innovation meets passion. Every team member is a vital piece of our success story. We are not just a company, but a dynamic community driven by the shared vision of redefining excellence. At Interclypse, you will find more than a career – you will discover a vibrant ecosystem where your talents are celebrated, your ideas are embraced, and your potential is achieved. Every Interclypse team member can benefit based on their efforts and collectively benefit through the overall company’s success. Join our mission to positively impact society, community, industry, and individuals by always “Doing What is Right”. Together, let's pioneer a future where greatness is achieved and exceeded.

To actualize this vision, Interclypse employs a growth mindset culture that empowers employees to rise in their careers by providing them with tools, mentorship, and a supportive environment to ensure long-term success.

Interclypse is supporting several Maryland state agencies in the modernization and sustainment of critical systems. This exciting opportunity provides candidates with the ability to contribute to the long-term health and success of the state while continuing to learn and grow professionally within Interclypse’s growth mindset culture.

All positions are required to be onsite at various locations in Maryland.

Make a difference. Join our team by applying today!

Responsibilities

The Quality Assurance Consultant provides quality management for information systems using the standard methodologies, techniques, and metrics for assuring product quality and key activities in quality management. This individual is responsible for performing the following tasks:

  • Establishing capable processes, monitoring and control of critical processes and product mechanisms for feedback of performance, implementing effective root cause analysis and corrective action system, and continuous process improvement;
  • Providing strategic quality plans in targeted areas of the organization;
  • Providing QA strategies to ensure continuous production of products consistent with established industry standards, government regulations, and customer requirements; and
  • Developing and implementing life cycle and QA methodologies and educating, and implementing QA metrics.
  • Develop and document test cases, testing plans and procedures in an agile environment
  • Develop, execute and coordinate IT software tests and evaluate results to ensure compliance with applicable regulations
  • Design and prepare all needed test data. Reviews test results and evaluates for conformance to design
  • Develop and maintain automated regression and integration test plans for validation
  • Communicate test results and feedback with business and IT stakeholders

Requirements

Required Qualifications

  • This position requires a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline is required.
  • Eight (8) years of experience as an analyst/tester on software projects in supporting requirement analysis, application test script development and execution.
  • Five (5) years of experience in mapping the business and technical requirements into test cases and generating test scripts.
  • Five (5) years of practical experience in using relational databases and generating SQL scripts is required.
  • Five (5) years of experience in using MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
  • Strong ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical teams and users.
  • Capable of triaging change requests, incidents during all phases of design, development, testing and training using tracking tools such as VersionOne or Jira.
  • Practical knowledge in manual and automated testing, 508 compliance, performance, UAT, Unit, regression and integration testing.
  • Experience with automated testing and automated testing tools.
  • Experience in testing Web application, Mobile application in a cross platform and browser environment.
  • Experience in testing Java, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJS, JMeter.

Why You Will Love Interclypse

  • You want to work for an adaptive company that moves at your speed.
  • You want a healthy work-life balance.
  • You want to work with a passionate team on an important mission.
  • You want to work for an organization that values and appreciates you.
  • You want to work for an organization that invests in your growth.
  • You want the option for career mentorship, both in technology and in business.
  • You value a company with a strong culture of growth and support.

Employee Impact Program

Every employee has the opportunity to be rewarded for the contributions they can make toward the long-term health of the company, our customers, and employees. This program in combination with our comprehensive benefits, time off and leave programs allow you to design a career and compensation program that enables unmatched flexibility while ensuring company, customer, and employee health and prosperity.

Benefits

  • Personal Time Off (PTO) for vacations, holidays, illnesses
  • Parental Leave
  • Bereavement Leave
  • Jury Duty Leave
  • Retirement: Unlimited 401K match up to 8% of your salary up to the federal maximum
  • Financial education and planning support
  • Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
  • Health Savings Account (HSA)
  • Medical and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Life Insurance
  • Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
  • Disability: Short-term and long-term disability coverage
  • Educational support
  • Company apparel
  • Social events: Holiday Party, Spring Picnic, Fall Picnic, happy hours and more.
  • Access to group rates for voluntary benefits such as Accident, Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness, Pet Insurance, and Identity Theft Protection

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

Interclypse is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

The base salary range provided is not adjusted for geographic differences associated with where the work is being performed. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, candidate’s experience and education/training, internal peer equity, and market and business consideration.
title: QA/Tester (Senior)

descriptionHtml:
Quality Assurance Analyst

Location: Huntsville, AL


Description

Seeking a highly motivated Quality Assurance Analyst to support Army Aviation and Missile programs for the Systems, Simulation, Software and Integration (S3I) Directorate.


The candidate will develop and assist in the implementation of quality programs for hardware, software, and service products.


Responsibilities and Requirements

  • Develops a Software Quality Assurance Surveillance Plan and documents quality activities in compliance with S3I processes and procedures.
  • Implements a system and software quality program per the S3I Quality Standard Operating Procedures and other quality processes and procedures and using ISO 9000-3 as a reference.
  • Supports the Army Materiel Release Process, as documented in Army Regulation 700-142, Type Classification, Materiel Release, Fielding, and Transfer; supports S3I's role in software materiel release determinations.
  • Supports S3I's SQA's material release activities, including suitability and supportability assessments, by providing needed project level software data.
  • Prepares change requests for the S3I quality processes and implement the changes once approved by the S3I Process Configuration Control Board (PCCB) or the S3I Quality Assurance Division Chief, as appropriate.
  • Reviews each project's defined process, solicitation, and management plan(s) for conformance to the EPIC process and provides feedback to the Project Leads.
  • Measures and analyzes the effectiveness of the process. Develop the organizational QC processes, which a project uses as a basis for their QC activities on a project. Conduct audits of projects' processes and deliverable products.
  • Audits the implementation of the QC processes on each project. Recommend improvements to the process(es).
  • Assists in development of management plans. Document process or product deficiencies via Quality Problem Reports (QPRs)


Required Skills

  • Must have active secret security clearance; must be a US Citizen
  • Software Quality experience
  • CMMI experience
  • Auditing experience
  • Demonstrated knowledge of software development life cycle
  • As required by Executive Order 14043, Federal employees, contractors, subcontractors, and consultants are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID- 19 regardless of the employee’s duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. If selected, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination before appointment or onboarding with HigherEchelon. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption prior to the start of their employment. Higher Echelon will provide additional information regarding what information or documentation will be needed and how you can request a legally required exception from this requirement.


Desired Skills

  • ISO 9001-2008 quality management system certifications.


Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, business, or other related scientific or technical discipline, or equivalent experience
  • 3-10 years of relevant work experience


About HigherEchelon, Inc.


HigherEchelon, Inc. (HE) is a service-disabled veteran owned small business (SDVOSB) organizational performance consulting firm with offerings in Engineering, Gaming & Simulation, Cyber Training, Salesforce, Enterprise Technology, and Human Capital. HigherEchelon aims to be the premier trusted partner in organizational excellence and achieves this through sustained investment in talent and the employee experience. HigherEchelon puts the employee first to better serve customer needs and sustain excellence.


HigherEchelon offers competitive full-time benefits including paid vacation and holidays, 401(k) matching, full health/dental/vision coverage, plus much more. For on-site and remote employees, flexible work schedules are offered when authorized.


By joining our team, you are choosing to embark on a journey towards excellence as a valued team member and trusted partner. We appreciate your inquiry and look forward to discussing the opportunity further.


EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled:


HigherEchelon, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in its job application procedures.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, citizenship, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. HigherEchelon, Inc. participates in E-Verify.
